content: Repository layout: bin/ for executables, lib/ for shared code if any, memory/ fo
Rebasing is preferred over merge commits for keeping history linear. Interactive
Log messages are sentences, not codes. stored entry #42 (decision), 3 triples ex
spill logs to a single SQLite database shared across all tools. Each log entry r
Force-pushing to main is acceptable because there is one developer. The rebase w
Log entries include the tool name as a structured field, not embedded in the mes
Each tool repo uses a single main branch with no feature branches. Commits go di
Commit messages use a tool-name prefix followed by a colon: crib: add consolidat
Spill provides three severity levels: info, warn, error. There is no debug level
No pre-commit hooks. The test suite runs in CI only. Local commits are fast and
book uses a SQLite task queue rather than Redis or a message broker. Keeps the d
The gemma3 1b model says yes to anything technology-adjacent when given vague co
The smoke test suite passed locally but failed in CI because ollama was not inst
Git tags are not used for versioning. Tools are pinned by commit hash when refer
The system does not use a message bus. Tools communicate through files and pipes
hooker evaluates policies in priority order: gates first, then transforms, then
Zero-shot classification with gemma3 1b fails on edge cases. The model needs at
Open3.capture3 is the standard way to call external commands in Ruby when you ne
Each tool exposes exactly one subcommand interface: tool_name action. No flags,
Antecedent basis rule: never reference internal module names or jargon in descri
